alert.note: Alert for Oglethorpe; Taliaferro; Wilkes (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 08 at 11:29PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Wilkes and southeastern Oglethorpe Counties through 1145 PM EST... At 1128 PM EST, a strong thunderstorm was near Rayle, or 10 miles southeast of Lexington, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Rayle, Jacksons Crossroads, Mallorysville, Newtown, Philomath and Celeste. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
